snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Bobby Petta | Feyenoord, Ipswich w/ Burley, Barnes, Celtic 6-2, Ajax Game, MON
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R 

Former Celtic winger, Bobby Petta sits down with Si to talk through his career which began coming through with some of the top youth players in Holland at hometown club, Feyenoord.

Bobby tells us about his introduction to UK football when he joined the lively dressing room at Ipswich led by George Burley and containing the likes of Kieron Dyer, Matt Holland, Jason Cundy and Tony Mowbray.

And we of course got onto the Dutchman's shining moments from his career and we talk through his move to Scottish giants, Celtic where he would play a key part in some of the most defining moments of Martin O'Neill's era at the club.

snippet.description:

Heady Tennis is back on the Open Goal channel with a 2-part special which sees the boys take on Rangers Legends Kenny Miller, Kris Boyd & Charlie Miller as well as current Celtic stars Leigh Griffiths and Mikey Johnston.

In Part 2, Open Goal FC are up against the Champions of Scotland, Celtic who are represented by striker Leigh Griffiths and winger, Mikey Johnston. A top standard for this one - have the boys got it in them to cause an upset?  

Also special commentary from Arsenal left-back Kieran Tierney for this one!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Lorenzo Amoruso | Life At Rangers, Captaincy, Advocaat Fallout, Fairytale Goodbye
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Rangers cult hero, Lorenzo Amoruso joins Simon this week to talk through his eventful 5-year spell at Ibrox which saw him arrive as a big money signing to replace outgoing 9-in-a-row captain, Richard Gough.

The big man's time wasn't without its talking points as he became one of few men to captain the club to a treble before losing the captaincy following a bust-up with manager, Dick Advocaat. He'd go onto recover and continue his position as a leader in the dressing room to eventually help the team to become treble champions once more in his final year.

It's all in there as Lorenzo is added to our long list of candid interviews with many of British football's top names!

snippet.title: Open Goal: On The Road with Shelley Kerr | #DriveSmart
snippet.description:
In Episode 3 of the Open Goal: On The Road, Si is driving from West Calder to Glasgow with Scotland Women's National Team Manager, Shelley Kerr!

Shelley tells her story as she drives Si around the old neighbourhood in West Calder before taking him along to Stirling University where she was the first woman to take control of the senior men's team. This is all on route to reaching the pinnacle of any Scotswoman's career to becoming the manager of the National Team and directing the Scotland to the historic 2019 Women's World Cup.

Sit back and enjoy!

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

It was a triumphant week for Scottish Clubs in Europe as both Celtic and Rangers defeated two of the top teams from Italy and Portugal and so the boys assess what’s left on the cards for the Glasgow teams in the competition. 

As the clock ticks closer to new appointments being made for Hibs and Hearts, we look at who should be getting the job as well as discuss a peculiar management appointment with former Scotlands target, Michael O’Neill joining Stoke.

Plus, don’t miss a special surprise guest appearing at the end of the show…

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Jimmy Nicholl | Leaving the Troubles, Man Utd, Rangers, Souness, McCoist, Coaching
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Jimmy Nicholl takes a trip down memory lane with Si Ferry, reflecting on a long career which has seen him play at the top level for the likes of Man Utd, Rangers and at two World Cups with Northern Ireland.

We also discuss his time as a coach including his famous trophy winning achievements with Raith Rovers, helping out with the national team and of course his recent tenure with Rangers.

Jimmy isn’t short of an hilarious story or two as he tells us some brilliant tales about the characters he’s shared a dressing room with over the years including George Best, Ally McCoist, Graeme Souness and Jock Wallace.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Niall McGinn | Gaelic & Derry, Life as a Celtic Player, Aberdeen, Korea, Euro 2016
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Aberdeen and Northern Ireland winger, Niall McGinn joins Si Ferry this week to discuss his career so far which has taken him from part-time football in Northern Ireland to a goal scorer for his country in one of the peak competitions in international football, Euro 2016.

Niall chats through his story along the way including signing for his boyhood heroes Celtic where he played alongside some big characters in a lively dressing room which inevitably leads to some great stories! 

The lads also review his most successful period with current club Aberdeen as they secured a historic cup win for the club under Derek McInnes as well as positioning themselves as league challengers to Celtic.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Paul Caddis | Celtic Upbringing, Start v Barca, Di Canio & Keeping Birmingham Up
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Si’s former teammate, Paul Caddis sits down with us this week as they look back on some of the highlights and funniest moments from the full backs career so far.

‘Caddy’ isn’t short of those stories as he reflects on some of the biggest personalities and characters he played with and under including the likes of Gordon Strachan, Paolo Di Canio, Zola, Tommy Gravesen, Artur Boruc and many more.

In a career which saw him make his first start at Celtic Park up against Ronaldinho and Barca to scoring the goal which saved Birmingham City’s Championship status, this is a story very much worth listening to.

snippet.title: PART 2 | A Tale of Two Games - Celtic 1 - 1 Rangers 2010
snippet.description:
Book in for a Tour at the Tennent's Story - http://www.tennentstours.com

SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Recorded from the new Tennent’s Story museum at Wellpark Brewery, we introduce to you ‘A Tale of Two Games’ where former rivals Scott McDonald and Lee McCulloch must select and discuss their favourite games with the only rule that the game must have involved both of them.

Part 2 hands the control over to Lee McCulloch as we return to Celtic Park in the year 2010 for his choice as Rangers look to end any hopes of a Celtic comeback in the league by avoiding defeat against Tony Mowbray’s Celtic as they seek their 2nd Championship in a row.

There is plenty of significance for Scott in this game also in what would turn out to be his last game for Celtic.

Decorated former Aberdeen, Rangers and Leeds United full back David Robertson joins Si to discuss his trophy-laden career as well as his well highlighted period as Real Kashmir FC Manger over in the most militarised area in India!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Stuart McCall | Bradford, Rangers 9IAR, Funny Squad, Managing Motherwell & Rangers
snippet.description:
Stuart McCall is our guest for this week’s very candid interview as he reflects on a career that has seen many pulsating highs and some heartbreaking and emotional lows through his time with Bradford, Everton and Rangers.

Stuart has the story book out as he also recounts some of the funniest times in his career alongside the many massive characters he played with including the likes of Ally McCoist, Gazza and many others.

We of course discuss Stuart’s time in management and the success he brought to Motherwell which eventually led to the team securing a Champions League spot in the SPFL Premiership as well as getting the inside track to the difficulties he experienced during his short reign at Ibrox.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Bob Malcolm | Rangers Youth, Advocaat, Treble, Ibrox Social Culture, 'Well & Oz
snippet.description:
Former Rangers man, Bob Malcolm joins Si this week to chat through his footballing career from doing the jobs as a young boy coming through at Ibrox to the facing challenges for his place under Advocaat and then becoming an treble winner for his boyhood club.

He also discusses life as a Rangers player during his era such as the social and drinking culture which was seen as the norm back in those days as well as the intensity of living in the Glasgow goldfish bowl as a Rangers player.

We also chat about Bob's life outside of Ibrox including his moves to Derby, Motherwell and Australia.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Joe Ledley | Cardiff, Beating the Best at Celtic, Palace & Wales Euro 2016
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Cardiff, Celtic, Crystal Palace & Derby midfielder Joe Ledley joins us this week to talk through his career journey so far.

Starting off as a top prospect with local side Cardiff, Joe discusses his quick trajectory into the 1st team and becoming the club’s captain at the age of 21, leading them to an FA Cup Final and a heartbreaking defeat in the play-off finals.

The boys also discuss his decision to leave Cardiff and seek to develop his career with Celtic where he would win numerous trophies and partake in one of the club’s greatest achievements in beating Barcelona.

Joe also touches on his first experiences of the Premier League with Crystal Palace and working with the likes of Sam Allardyce and Neil Warnock.

And we of course couldn’t forget to ask about Joe’s memories of Wales’ stunning performance at Euro 2016 as he looks back fondly on the amazing route which saw them reach the Semi-Finals

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Current Sporting Kansas star man Johnny Russell is in the hot seat this week as he and Si get a good laugh looking back on the highs and lows of the striker’s career thus far.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Mark Warburton | Life as the Rangers Manager, Brentford & Starting in the City
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Rangers Manager, Mark Warburton is our guest this week as he opens up to Si on his eventful period in charge of the Ibrox club as we discuss his opening season which saw him clinch promotion to the Premiership, defeat rivals Celtic in a dramatic penalty shootout and agonisingly lose the Scottish Cup Final to Hibs in the last minute.


Furthermore, Mark goes into the different challenges he faced in his 2nd season when expectations were risen and new faces arrived as he attempted to steer the club back to a competitive level again.

Also plenty of chat from his successful time at Brentford and his pathway into football having taken an unorthodox route after working as a trader in the City for a number of years.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - williamhill.com

The larger than life personality that is Jason Scotland joins us for an hilarious chat through his career with loads great stories on the teams he’s played with and the characters he’s shared a dressing room with.

We go right through the Trinidad man’s time in football including his introduction to British football with Dundee United alongside mad characters like Charlie Miller and Andy McLaren, St Johnstone with Owen Coyle as well as Swansea and Wigan with Martinez. A couple of great Roy Keane stories in there also from his time at Ipswich!

The big man also looks back on one of the most famous moments for Hamilton Accies as they defeated Hibs in the Premiership play-off to reach the top flight again under Alex Neill.
